alert.note: Alert for Northwestern Nye County (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 10 at 3:43PM PDT by NWS Elko
info.description: ...Gusty winds and potential for blowing dust in northwest Nye County... A weather disturbance and frontal boundary will move through central Nevada Wednesday bringing a mix of light rain and snow showers to northwestern Nye county. However, the more impactful weather element will be the gusty northwest winds that develop during and after the frontal passage beginning late morning into the afternoon hours. Northwest winds of 15-25 mph with gusts to 40 mph will be common with wind prone areas experiencing wind gusts around 45 mph. This has the potential to generate blowing dust in the area as precipitation is expected to be light. Use caution while driving particularly on exposed summits and passes. Improving conditions including diminishing showers and decreasing winds are expected Wednesday night into Thursday. Visit www.weather.gov/elko for the latest weather information.
